result.execSummary:
The defendant Judith Lynn Milton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Judith Lynn Milton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Judith Lynn Milton was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Concurrent to current Probation sentence.
Defendant to report to Probation by October 12, 2016 by 1:30 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Judith Lynn Milton appeared. Case called at 3:56 pm. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. No objection from Atty Caton.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #1. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty to Count #1. Court dismisses Count #2. Parties make sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. 
Court orders: 1 year probation w/h with conditions - 
- 60 Days Jail STAYED
- Court modifies court costs to zero due amount paid toward UA's
- DNA Sample and Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA and complete treatment
- Cooperate with any evaluation, assessment and/or program as directed by agent.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Sign up for probation by 1:30 pm on 10/12/2016
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

CO: Vlack, DAR: Desotelle, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Judith Lynn Milton appeared. Includes STC on 16CM2, and RH on 14CM517 and 15CM169. Case called at 9:50 am. ADA Nieskes makes statement. ADA Nieskes requests another date on 16CM2. Def has requested to travel. Defendant to test by 8:00 am on 6/24/2016 and to test no later than 10:00 pm on 6/26/2016 at the Sheriff's Dept. There will be no tests on 6/25/2016. Regular tests to resume on 6/27/2016. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Clerk to fax minutes to Sheriffs Dept and New Richmond PD. km  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Def. Re: treatment. Sealed. km
Status conference on June 16, 2016 at 09:45 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, James Mulvey.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Defendant to continue PBT tests at New Richmond Police Department in the presence of an officer at $5.00 per test every day 8:00 am - noon. If Def tests postive Def to be taken into custody of the jail to take an intxometer

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, James Mulvey.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- DE to test clean before release. 

- Defendant to continue PBT tests at New Richmond Police Department in the presence of a same sex officer at $5.00 per test.every day 7:00 am - 7:00 pm. 


Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
